> Michael Silverstein wrote:
> 
> > To rule out the effects of JUnit, try running a class with that code
> > without JUnit. If you have the same problem then its not 
> the fault of
> > JUnit.
> > 
> 
> Good call!  Turns out, I'm barking up the wrong tree.

Did you solve it yet?

After moving your classes  into a package, 
have you re-generated the *.h and *.c and the *.dll files?
The c function names contain the full package path.
Maybe the system is looking for e.g.:

JNIEXPORT jstring JNICALL Java_com_xyz_runMyDLL
  (JNIEnv * env, jobject this)

but in the dll only is 

JNIEXPORT jstring JNICALL Java_runMyDLL
  (JNIEnv * env, jobject this)

?

Bernd
subject: RE: [junit] JNI (Shudder!)
